title: Vogrie Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Richard Webb / Vogrie Country Park.
images.caption: Vogrie Country Park signs and footpath.

images.title: Vogrie House by ronnie leask, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Vogrie House. The house was built for James Dewar and his family in 1876 by Andrew Heiton, the town architect for Perth. Dewar was the creator of Dewar's whisky. It is an example of Victorian baronial splendour and is said to be one of the best surviving examples of Heiton's work.

images.title: Cycle sculpture, Vogrie Country Park by Tom Richardson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cycle sculpture.

images.title: Richard Webb / Car park, Vogrie
images.caption: Car park. The park is being used for a small orienteering event.

images.title: The valley of the Tyne Water by M J Richardson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The valley of the Tyne Water at the southern end of the park.

images.title: Richard Webb / Currie Lee.
images.caption: Currie Lee. House perched on the lip of the Tyne gorge amongst sheep pasture.

images.title: Tyne Water, Vogrie by Richard Webb, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tyne Water. This stream is located in the woodland section on the eastern side of the park.

images.title: Walled garden, Vogrie Country Park by Jim Barton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Walled garden in autumn.

description: Explore this beautiful Victorian Parkland Estate located in the heart of the Midlothian countryside. The park contains several walking and cycling trails taking you through the acres of woodland and parkland which surround the baronial-styled Vogrie House. There are several pretty water features to enjoy with ponds, burns and the River Tyne running through the park. Also make time to visit the pretty walled garden and the Rookery. The peaceful woodland contains a variety of different trees including Oak, Rowan and Red Cedar. It's a haven for wildlife so look out for Jay, Nuthatch and Woodpeckers. Vogrie has several additional attractions with a nine hole golf course, miniature railway and the Cedar Tree Cafe. There is also a Ranger Service which organises guided walks through the grounds. The estate is located about 10 miles south east of Edinburgh, near Dalkeith where you could visit Dalkeith Country Park .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Tree Top cafe is located in Vogrie House. You can enjoy a good range of meals and snacks after your exercise here. There's also some outdoor seating if the sun is shining.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and parkland trails make for a great dog walk. It's a popular place so you'll probably meet other owners with their pets on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To the south west is the village of Gorebridge where you can pick up the Gorebridge Circular Walk and explore the area around the historic village. Highlights include the Gore Glen Woodland Park with walks along Gore Water and views of the Pentland Hills.

display_address: B6372, Dewartown, Ford, Midlothian, Alba / Scotland, EH23 4NU, United Kingdom
